Articles.Content:
As the 50th anniversary special of Doctor Who is tomorrow (23/11/13, 7:50 pm, BBC 1),

what are your expectations?
I expect it will contain a lot of doctors.
I hope it will be awesome.
I am so excited I can't describe it... Not even ponnies and unicorns gets me this excited (Joke, I'm no brony... or anything like that...)
Let's just hope Moffat hasn't let us down again.
I'm just excited about some more Tennant.

It's at 2:30 pm for me.

My TARDIS awaits...

I hope the do a mlp reference...because you know they do air on the same day...

oh and things like this
All I want is to finally figure out why I like DW
I'm watching it here noon tomorrow:
I want to see Tom Baker. I don't care if he's 70.

I want it to be awesome

Also, google did a doodle for Dr Who, (currently only up on the British site)

Edited November 22, 2013 by hawkinator

I want it to be awesome

Also, google did a doodle for Dr Who, (currently only up on the British site)

I'm a terrible doctor,27 regenerations and 45 minutes of play-time.

My first try was about half an hour and I went from Hartnell to Smith

Best try, 7 minutes 33 seconds, Eccleston -> Smith

Edited November 22, 2013 by hawkinator
I can make all the levels except the last one for no regenrations.
am I the only one that is bothered that all of thedoctors have the same sonic screwdriver?

it will be on at 10:30am ish. why you brittish time?

am I the only one that is bothered that all of thedoctors have the same sonic screwdriver?

william hartnell didnt need no screwdriver

6:30am for my episode.. Yay!

Im expecting at least Tennant and Smith...

I want it to be awesome

Also, google did a doodle for Dr Who, (currently only up on the British site)

Im in Australia and I get that doodle. https://www.google.com.au/

am I the only one that is bothered that all of thedoctors have the same sonic screwdriver?

Why wouldn't he keep the same sonic screwdriver? No reason to replace it unless he breaks or loses it.
Today is The Day!

Prediction for the ending based on previous seasons: Everything will be solved with ~the power of love~, 11 makes a huge speech and cries his eyes out, and then someone dies but is brought back to life. ALSO OH NO A DALEEKK! RUN AWAY. ITS NOT LIKE WE'VE KILLED THEM BEFORE.

Also I find the lack of Christopher Eccleston disturbing.

I'm still going to watch it anyways. There are plenty of Doctor Who episodes that weren't dissapointments. Plus it's not like anything could get worse than Love & Monsters. *shudder*
Poop, I'm missing this. Ah, well, this night hike better be good if I'm missing Doctor Who for it.
I hope for an appearance by the First doctor.

Whoo! That was a wonderful episode, and spoilers in white

And Tom Bakers appearence was the best. Personally, he was the best Doctor. And also, with them NOT killing the Time Lords, that was a plot twist
